title: THeWildking
author: THeWildking
content: Assan Verse fourth round bounty payment not paying properly or bounty managers.They run the bounty for 16 weeks.After 16 weeks of work, it was found that most of the participants' addresses did not match their main addresses.Even Instagram username, Telegram username and Facebook username are not matching.In the final speedsheet they put their desired wallet address.As a result, many bounty hunters are deprived of the payment they receive even after working.https://t.me/Jamescarlos_zAnd https://t.me/Cryptoworldman If you message them, they don't see it and even after seeing it, they don't reply.Bounty link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5441648.0I am showing you the spreadsheet of ASAN VERS round 4 Bounty.https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1P55K6hTjnfwX9Z1GpzR9SagE-AjhRC6fkNN1PY8uXbI/edit?usp=drivesdkI am a new and newbie member but I don't get paid to work on their campaigns.So I am reporting this to you and request you to take action against them so that no future bounty hunters are deprived of their payment.Thanks Everyone üôèüôè

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: You are using alt for reporting because you have not joined Asanverse bounty. I tried to ask bounty manager for real issue but he blocked me. maybe bounty hunters harassed him. bounty group also stopped for doing conversation. Without full Proof DT member cannot do anything. Click on image to see full

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: But they were paying, unless I am mistaken? Granted, I am not familiar with klaytn explorer, but picking a random address from their spreadsheet and run it out to the explorer shows that the said participant indeed received 510,000 ASAN. Though I am somewhat dubious about the project itself.Assuming the best of my gender bias, either this is a questionable team details or his parents have a very good taste of humor. I run a search through each of their image and it came back with zero result, though.

comments.author: Buddyspa
comments.body: Although I don't participate in it but I heard my friend that participated lamenting bitterly about it To be honest 16 weeks and getting paid with that is a little harsh.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Oddly enough that none of the original participants didn't make such a report, I became doubtful of the seriousness of the problems in this campaign. If you focus on failing to distribute rewards, reports posted by unrelated users won't get much attention afaik.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: THeWildking on June 23, 2023, 06:37:57 AMSo I am reporting this to you and request you to take action against them so that no future bounty hunters are deprived of their payment.Unfortunately the forum does not moderate scams...The bitter truth about bounty hunters is that if eventually this turns out to be true that this campaign manager is stealing funds in the way that was described in Op and then DT members tag him or several flags were created against him, if he should create a new bounty campaign despite all the tags and flags in his profile bounty hunters will still register and participate in it even if they don't get paid for all the campaigns that they participate in. I kept wondering if perhaps most of those bounty hunters accounts are being controlled by bots.

comments.author: Avirunes
comments.body: Quote from: holydarkness on June 24, 2023, 04:07:26 PMBut they were paying, unless I am mistaken? Granted, I am not familiar with klaytn explorer, but picking a random address from their spreadsheet and run it out to the explorer shows that the said participant indeed received 510,000 ASAN. Though I am somewhat dubious about the project itself/I think so that they have received whatever was due. I randomly picked an address and found that the participant indeed was paid as shown in the sheet with name "FINAL" - https://scope.klaytn.com/account/0x53C7AFeb45CaD6D71167Caf6241bCD7aBe1e3AFF?tabId=tokenTransfer. It is though harsh to block participants and not listening to their queries and problems. Maybe OP is doing something wrong here so would suggest to check again, sometimes one has to tweak their wallet settings in order to access those tokens as well.@OP try checking your address on klaytn explorer as holydarkness has made in quoted^^ post.

comments.author: avp2306
comments.body: Quote from: THeWildking on June 23, 2023, 06:37:57 AMI am a new and newbie member but I don't get paid to work on their campaigns.So I am reporting this to you and request you to take action against them so that no future bounty hunters are deprived of their payment.Thanks Everyone üôèüôèConsidering a lot of warning against joining those bounty campaign you should take precautions upon joining then accept the fact that their are instances that you cannot get paid due to scams circulated in that category. Also for continue joining campaigns which we don't know if they pay you just making those scammers scam many people because you are helping them to promote their scan project. So if I where those people who still seeking a bounty campaign to join they better stop it because majority is a scam.

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: Avirunes on June 25, 2023, 06:58:11 AM[...]@OP try checking your address on klaytn explorer as holydarkness has made in quoted^^ post.The problem is, OP is not even on their bounty campaign, can't find their name on the spreadsheet, just like Buddyspa, they're just here on "friend's" behalf, so I am not even sure what's the point of this thread

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: OP, can you please specify the purpose of this thread? And give proper evidences while you're at it. The nature of the project, Asan Vers, itself aside, the accusations you raised against the bounty manager for this case is rather baseless. They're paying, and this evidence below,Quote from: THeWildking on June 25, 2023, 10:54:53 AMYou are right he is a bengali so he scolded one of my friends after asking him for payment.I present its evidence to you.@cryptoworlddev/ https://t.me/cryptoworlddevHe scolded my friend after asking him for payment.https://t.me/hdkskbsk7837 This is another telegram account of his that he has been fooling around with.https://t.me/hdkskbsk7837He is a fraud and scammer as his proof is written in his telegram bio.I am not sure how it contributes to the case, or is there a way that ties the username hdskbsk7837 to cryptoworlddev and their management?Unless what you're raising is a thread about how the bounty management is supporting and managing a questionable project?

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: THeWildking on June 25, 2023, 10:54:53 AMYou are right he is a bengali so he scolded one of my friends after asking him for payment.I present its evidence to you.If so, direct your friend to provide evidence or clues here, other members will help investigate why your friend was skipped to get paid. Without it, your accusations are completely weightless. Your description differs from the fact, bounty participants have already been paid.

comments.author: Shobhikhan_007
comments.body: Hi I'm writing this because I faced the same situation not only his Asan bounty but also in Oscarswap bounty. I worked 16 weeks and during the 13-16 weeks he bring coinmarketcap event and those who don't did it correctly no reward. That's how he reduce the bounty workers to 300 persons. Once I submitted and he said time over but in my timezone I submitted the proofs couple of mins before the timeline he gave. I didn't upset also because at that week I was with my sister in hospital because she caught dengue. So I thought it's ok, but I told him whole story and he said not worry you are eligible keep work. So after 16 week I check my work stakes and everything updated correctly and no worries at all. During this period his previous bounty Oscarswap final results was released and somehow half of people work in that bounty was ineligible for reward. I pm him, no replay and then he make announcement saying if someone talk it in the bounty group or official project group he/she will be banned and he did it. Then asan final sheet was announced and when I check it I got 35$ for 16 weeks and my details raw in the excel sheet was green. But after 3-4 hours passed and again checked the sheet my reward was reduced for 25$ and my raw was red, but no reason for that. So I ask what did I do tell me the reason because he did this same in his oscar bounty. Messages are seen but no replay, group closed and then he as previous his bounty he told not to complain it, if someone complain in his inbox or group he will banned. So I asked in the group "how can we trust you in the next bounty if you work and act like this?". I kicked out, then I went to see what happens in official telegram group, surprisingly he is an admin in that group also and he delete all the messages regarding complaining about him. I'm sharing my experience because I worked in 3 bounty that he did and same experience in the 3 bounty projects. Everything changed after bounty over. wallet address changed, stakes changed, people kicked out when complains and etc... If anyone can joined his group and stay there until one bounty over you can see that I'm not lie. I don't have single faith that my reward will be back to me. But I want to share the experience here. Most people are not complaining because they worry that they won't be able to do next bounty on his, So he take it as a opportunity and rip off the workers. I believe mod will take this serious and observe his next works and action. Thank you

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Quote from: holydarkness on June 25, 2023, 12:32:24 PMOP, can you please specify the purpose of this thread? And give proper evidences while you're at it. The nature of the project, Asan Vers, itself aside, the accusations you raised against the bounty manager for this case is rather baseless. They're paying, and this evidence below,O think OP is just Bounty Hunter and don't know how to report someone. This thread cannot prove BM scam. There js another thread in wrong section which is much better and some proof has been given there. I will invite Lovemyfamily, albon, RikafiP and other detector to check this issue. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5457428.new#new

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Gladitorcomeback on June 26, 2023, 05:43:12 AMThere js another thread in wrong section which is much better and some proof has been given there. I will invite Lovemyfamily, albon, RikafiP and other detector to check this issue. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5457428.new#newI would gladly help and tag that (alleged) scammer, but that other thread is not much better either and its kinda hard to decipher what's really going on there. Speaking generally, I wouldn't be surprised if bounty manager decided to steal from bounty hunters, but what once again surprises me is that hundreds of bounty hunters are willing to join bounty campaign lead by a Jr Member account that can be easily ditched.

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on June 26, 2023, 02:51:35 PMQuote from: Gladitorcomeback on June 26, 2023, 05:43:12 AMThere js another thread in wrong section which is much better and some proof has been given there. I will invite Lovemyfamily, albon, RikafiP and other detector to check this issue. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5457428.new#newI would gladly help and tag that (alleged) scammer, but that other thread is not much better either and its kinda hard to decipher what's really going on there. Speaking generally, I wouldn't be surprised if bounty manager decided to steal from bounty hunters, but what once again surprises me is that hundreds of bounty hunters are willing to join bounty campaign lead by a Jr Member account that can be easily ditched. That thread came to my awareness last night when I am about to sleep, so I didn't do much other than archiving their spreadsheet just in case it got locked or we need them for future reference.Reading that thread again today when I have free time at hand, I have to agree that it is not much better. If any, it just further complicate things as that thread is --in a way-- validate the BM's decision to cross some people from the final sheet, as specified on their rules of no multi-acc, there's quite a big chances that bounty is filled with multi-acc abuses, given people posting on that thread are mostly tagged in the past for that violation and they're waking up from a long inactivity just to protest there, and they're not even enrolling that account on Asan Verse. The other reason why people are disqualified from the bounty was because they posted on Asan's group, which was also not allowed as per the bounty rule.Though... I looked at the group again and it seems there are cases of changed wallet address, the representative of Asan Verse even acknowledged this,Is there an allegation or findings by someone that the BM redirect those "replaced wallet" to their own? I might will take a look at other campaign managed by the BM, if it could fit on my currently swamped days.
